name: Ron Wyatt
text: They folks at Sunbelt helped us in our time of need, our disaster response trailer had a broken hub. They helped installing the new hub, bearings and seals and repacked the bearings on the other three wheels. It was a true blessing. Thank you to everyone at Sunbelt!!!

name: Ron Wyatt
text: They folks at Sunbelt helped us in our time of need, our disaster response trailer had a broken hub. They helped installing the new hub, bearings and seals and repacked the bearings on the other three wheels. It was a true blessing. Thank you to everyone at Sunbelt!!!

name: Ginny Caspar
text: These are a great bunch of folks and heroes in their own right!!!!! Like all first responders, when others are running away from danger, they're running into it!  They have families too yet they put their lives on the line to save ours because that's the kind of people they are!

name: Alexandria Johnson
text:
To whom it may concern,
Those people are absolutely amazing. They work their normal jobs and volunteered to help put out fires on the side as well as save lives. They treat each other like family, (and throw great Christmas parties, too). Their explorer program is excellent from what I have heard from the explorers. Hope to join them someday.
From,
The daughter of  Pete

name: Walt Gay
text: Always there when you need them!

name: Rainy Day
text: Some of the best guys around.

name: Roland Vance
text: ssssssssssssssssssss

name: Charles Folts
text: Great group people

name: Mary Sparman
text: Not a good fire department

name: Michael Paradis
text: Visited the downtown Mobile  Al Firehouse. A great experience and very enjoyable conversations with some of the rescue crew.  A major part of the history of Mobile.

name: Trace Oeight
text:
STEVE HUFFMAN DRAWS LINE BETWEEN MFRD ANS KIDS AS YOUNG AS 10

"They see it as a prank, we see it as arson," Huffman said. "That's just a warning for high school and middle school students -- we don't play."

Its a war zone out there isn't it huff? and the enemy is short and all dress alike....

name: matthew keller
text: Very quick

name: JAMES PRICE
text: Very professional

name: J C
text: Good fire department. A great bunch of guys.

name: Daniel Ivey
text: They need more education. I have called twice in the last two months for fires that are on the ban but never got back and never pick up the phone.

name: Jim Dunning
text: I am a diabetic I was going into suger coma and the medical team saved my life. They are the best

name: T Young
text: Rosalie VFD and Rescue Squad members are some of the best people you're likely to meet around here. They'll give you the shirt off their backs. Never have I seen a group of people manage to do so much with so very little in order to better the lives of those in need  around our community.

name: Tim Young
text: You couldn't find a better group of volunteers that work hard helping the community and just down home friends. Thanks for being there when we need you.

name: Aaron Dettling
text: It's great to have such a professional fire department so close to home.  These guys are great.

name: Buddy Smith
text: Great place to meet for K-9 transport.  Very wide open spaces. The station  building is well kept, paved parking  and easy to see.

name: K T
text: Always professional, polite and helpful. Have helped me a couple times and was always a good experience. Thank y'all for your service!  👍👍

name: Patrick Reno
text: Fantastic service from these young men. Thank you to the heroes of Center Point Fire! Especially those sexy mavericks on that Rescue 11 😍😍

name: Tina Thomas
text: I want to say a special thank you to the paramedics and staff for their professionalism on Sunday March 10 when my elderly mom fell out of the shower. Their delicate treatment of her made her feel comfortable in her present condition. To all of the rssponders we thank you so much.

name: penny jackson
text: I am very disappointed with the Center Point fire dues my fire dues continue to raise every year $20 is added to my fire dues each year my payment is beyond the cost for a single family home

name: Kellie Gilbert
text: Great Service for my hometown community!

name: Dante Foxx
text: Let the phone ring for about 10 minutes. Hung up tried again for 5 minutes. No answer. 630 pm

name: I.O.U
text: It's always feel safe when these first responders around and making Anniston feel safe thank you from my family to yours.

name: C Taylor
text: Spectacular group of people.

name: Ashley White
text: Great chief and wonderful staff not only amazing volunteers but amazing speed to get there and help.....

name: Devin Hadden
text: Just stay out of there vehicles.

name: Patsy Cothren
text: Station 6 is well deserved in our area; we definitely need these men knowing we have this safety.  Well trained firemen ready to spring into action 24/7.  Job well done gentlemen, you all are great firemen and this area appreciates you.

name: Gary Grimes
text: Very helpful with child car seats etc.  Great staff.

name: David Gibson
text: Glad they are here!

name: Al W.
text: they stop fire very good

name: Zavier De'Sine
text:
True caring professionals. I know I feel safer now knowing that it will be one of yours helping me if I ever need it.

I have a rare medical condition that needs a fast response for it to not become a much more serious if not downright fatal condition. Your team's response was all I could have asked for. So thank you.

name: Raymond “ReD” David Smith
text: Nice people. They don't make a big deal when they see me walking around in the lot playing ingress.

name: Rody Davis
text: Awesome people!

name: Destiny Fitch
text: Great people

name: Byrdman Byrdman
text: I was having back spasm and couldn't move out of the chair that I was sitting in my wife called them and they were here within minutes and helped me move to where I WAS MORE COMFORTABLE.  THANK YOU GUYS.

name: Michael Hayes
text:
It's a small station but boy are these dudes busy. I live on top of the hill above their station so I hear them every time they get a call. These guys also climb the "hill" (they'll know what I mean) every day, sometimes in full gear in the middle of summer.

Whatever it takes to stay in tip top shape, I guess, but geez - that is a rough one even without the turnout gear!

name: Donna Morgan
text: Wonderful Firemen & first responders! We were driving down the road & I thought, I was having a heart attack. My husband pulled in & they all came out with their equipment & check me & suggested I go on to the hospital for a EKG!

name: John Mcneal
text: Nice customer service. Would recommend to everyone. Try the burger with bacon and onions with sour skittles, fries and the occasional yoohoo. And they are open late.

name: Chris Day
text: Nice people

name: Brandy Rivers
text: Looks closed but the power is still on

name: John Paul
text: No number to call

name: Jenna Herring
text: I will give them worse than a 1 star. They do stuff very illegal. I'll see them in court

name: Tracy Thrasher
text: Dora police department is amazing I locked my keys in my truck at work and Jared Hall was amazing he came out and got my keys out there the best thank you

name: Adam Swedenburg
text: Very friendly firefighters. They had a quick response to our call and was very willing to help.

name: Adam Swedenburg
text: They are great people. They don't mind helping in any way they can. They have very fast response times.

name: Mobile Notary Public
text:
(Translated by Google) 9 months ago I had an accident in Wallahatchie Rd, the weather was horrible as it was going through a tropical depression, the car slipped and I ended up in a pasture with the car pulled apart, the men who work here were exaggeratedly gentle, there were 4 ready to help of them, the oldest of them very professional but above all with a great heart and the others following in the footsteps of the eldest, it shows that they are well trained but above all the warmth of the people and most of all the compassion they have for the people In the 20 years that I have been in this country, I have not seen that firefighters were so humanitarian, I will always carry them in my memories, thanks for everything.

(Original)
Hace 9 meses tube un accidente en Wallahatchie Rd, el clima estaba horrible ya que estaba pasando una depression tropical, el auto se resbalo y termine en un potrero con el carro desrrozado, los senores que trabajan aqui fueron exageradamente gentiles, listos para ayudar eran 4 de ellos, el mayor de ellos muy profecional pero sobre todo con una gran corazon y los demas siguiendo los pasos del mayor, se nota que estan bien entrenados pero sobre todo la calidez de personas y mas que nada la compasion que ellos tienen por la gente, en 20 años que llevo en este pais no habia visto que los bomberos fueran asi de humanitarios, los llevare siempre en mis recuerdos, gracias por todo.

name: Stephanie TheAnimeLover
text: Great fire station, they are very helpful person .I respect them.

name: Mike Halls
text:
All they guys there were so friendly.
And attractive.
I just felt sooooo comfortable with my true self there. I didn't have to hide who I was!
The chief is like a cute little Indian

name: tosha williams
text: I stopped in at this fire station to have my blood pressure checked. I knocked at the door and a S.J. Mullins opned it. I told him what I wanted and he invited me in. Looks like he was eating lunch but he walked me to a spot where they check your pressure. My pressure reading was so high Mullins the fireman began to conversate with me in an attempt to calm me down as I was visible upset over my 1st reading. Mullins took the TIME to make polite chit chat while I calmed down for a few minutes then he took my pressure again and it was 20 points lower after a few calming moments with Mullins. I GREATLY appreciate his polite and caring attitude and feel  Mullins has to be part of a great TEAM at this fire station.      THANK YOU!

name: T “Lady T” CL
text: Friendly staff

name: Doc Thor
text: Nice park and vary clean

name: Robert Schumaker
text: Volunteer fire departments are the emergency responders of Rural America. Volunteers of Fort Mitchell fire department are dedicated, well trained, and dedicated folks. Fort Mitchell Fire Department stands ready to assist its community and neighbors in their time of need.

name: Rose Flores
text: Theres a playground

name: Pat Trawick
text: Friendly volunteers

text: Hardworking and helpfull people

text: Volunteer Fire Department

name: hopbalaa. com
text: Beautiful city

name: Smitty Johnson
text: Speak with one inspector and the desk attendant and they say they can't issue a urn permit outside the city limits. Call in another day and they say one is required. They don't even know their own rules and will leave you responsible for their ignorance.

name: John LaGrone
text: Thanks for a Great Job from Affordable Decks

name: James Layne
text: Tuscaloosa fire marshall needs to go inspect the DOLLAR general in coaling for access to a fire.coaling fire chief is not doing his job.at the dollar general if a fire would be in.front of store the fire exit is always blocked.

name: Turo Tales
text: Family friendly camping in a beautiful area. Came here for a father's and sons camp.  Will return.

name: Brian Dunbar
text: Beautiful park. My friends got married here and it was lovely.

name: Jesse Jasnoch
text:
I visited Blue Springs State Park on January 2nd- at like 8:30AM...Not optimal for most folks.

However, it only cost me $3 to get in and I had the park entirely to myself. The Blue Springs were beautiful and the water was crystal clear. I had a great time taking pictures, walking slow, and breathing in the fresh air. The staff at the front gate were REALLY nice as well!

Plenty of stuff to do for all: Camping, Fishing, Wading in the Springs, Paddle Boats, Picnicking, Walking, Play Ground for the Kiddos and I think I saw a Volleyball net too.

BTW: Right across the street is Hagler's Bar-B-Que. Its Awesome too!

Good Talk,
JJ

name: Randy Turner
text: beautiful park and campground .plenty of shade trees to watch your kids play in pool .campground is wooded clean and nice .if you can entertain yourself you will love it .haglers has great bbq

name: Dutch D
text: Nice park, quiet. Right by a creek fed by cristal clear water from the parks spring. They even rent out on site campers at a good rate.  Just remember to bring everything with you because shopping is limited in ths area.

name: Kenny Smith
text: I enjoyed the park n friends n the fishing n volleyball great times there.

name: Jessica Cottrell
text: Only problem I had were the restrooms they're NEVER clean and fresh. Maintenance is much needed!

name: Rachel Carroll
text: Iv never been but going this weekend but jugeing by what iv heard and the views I think ill. Have a great time

name: Marie Akers
text: Pretty but my 8 year old daughter called it "lame" it was dead when we went.

name: Shawn McCormick
text: Off of the beaten path. As stated in a previous post bring everything you need with you.

name: Robert Schultz
text:
(Translated by Google) Big park, lots of space, extremely helpful ranger. Top!

(Original)
Großer Park, viel Platz, äußerst hilfreicher Ranger. Top!

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Heroes work here.

name: Michael Todd
text: Great place to have a station, these guys work very hard and deserve recognition at all times

name: Cctrapper 2
text: We have proudly served the Tucker's chapel community since 1973. We are a all volunteer fire department that severe Cherokee county and help area departments. We also help with search and rescue in Little River canyon. We have our open house each May.

text: Clean and vacant. Just had to turn around cause I was lost.

text: Great department

name: Toni Michelle
text: So helpful and caring!! Lucky to have them.

text: Their good station Jacob Clint Roy its Mike177 son Harley ray station 5.

text: Great people

name: Kelly E
text: This fire dept is made up of volunteers. Always a hat tip to those who serve the community!

name: Art Of Valor
text: Good response times and very dedicated employees!

name: Jazz 8712
text: Swift and efficient response times.

name: Artonious Thomas
text: Great hard working guys who stay vigilant and dedicated to keeping our city safe.

name: USA NORTE AMERICA
text: the best fire department in Gadsden God bless and care for you always

name: Anneliese Hanson
text: 10:10 great place to make a U-Turn on 280 when you're from out of town and the street signs are dark/dirty/hidden by trees. I'm not sure WHY the city doesn't put up signs saying what the next road is an 1/8 of a mile before the cross-street. Everyone drives like 10,000mph on 280, so rather than risk my life taking an ill-advised left turn onto Cahaba River Road (curse you, Google!) I decided to pull into this driveway a couple times after I missed my turn. Only complaint is that it takes forever to get a chance to make a left turn. I suppose it is also a functional fire station, but my review is mostly centered around my needs as a lost motorist, at the mercy of Google maps.

name: David Gibson
text: Thank you guys. Glad you are here watching out of the community!
